se.ltu.android.demo.sensors
Class MPMovingAverageFilter

java.lang.Object
  se.ltu.android.demo.sensors.MPMovingAverageFilter

public class MPMovingAverageFilter
extends java.lang.Object

A Multiple-Pass (and somewhat weighted) Moving Average Filter.

Field Detail

Frequency

public static float Frequency
Average time (in gigahertz) between two samples. Change this if you don't use the fastest rate. On the Android Dev Phone 1: SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST ~= 50Hz = 0.02s SENSOR_DELAY_GAME ~= unknown TODO get all sensor delays for G1

See Also:
SensorManager.SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST
Constructor Detail

MPMovingAverageFilter

public MPMovingAverageFilter(int nSamples,
                             int nPasses,
                             int nElements)
Creates a new filter with a set amount of samples and passes. The number of samples must be greater than 1 and the number of passes must be at least 1. Otherwise this filter will just work as a pass-through.

Parameters:
nSamples - number of samples
nPasses - number of passes
nElements - the number of elements to be filtered individually

MPMovingAverageFilter

public MPMovingAverageFilter(int nSamples,
                             int nPasses)
Creates a new filter with provided amount of samples and passes. The number of samples must be greater than 1 and the number of passes must be at least 1. Otherwise this filter will just work as a pass-through.

Parameters:
nSamples - number of samples
nPasses - number of passes

MPMovingAverageFilter

public MPMovingAverageFilter(int nSamples)
Creates a new filter with one pass and provided amount of samples. The number of samples must be greater than 1. Otherwise this filter will just work as a pass-through.

Parameters:
nSamples - number of samples
Method Detail

addSamples

public void addSamples(float[] sample)
Add a sample to the filter. This does not compute any weighting.

Parameters:
sample - Sample to add. The elements of this array will be filtered individually.

addSamples

public void addSamples(float[] sample,
                       long time)
Add a sample to the filter. This method compares the given time with the last time a sample was added to see if there is a large gap. Then it tries to fill that gap by adding this sample one or several times.

Parameters:
sample - Sample to add. The elements of this array will be filtered individually.
time - Time in nanoseconds. Such as those already given from the sensors.

getResults

public void getResults(float[] result)
Sets the given array with the latest results from this filter

Parameters:
result - results
